metadata.title: CVE-2024-53008 on Ubuntu 24.10 (oracular) - medium
metadata.description:
Inconsistent interpretation of HTTP requests ('HTTP Request/ResponseSmuggling') issue exists in HAProxy. If this vulnerability is exploited,  aremote attacker may access a path that is restricted by ACL (Access ControlList) set on the product. As a result, the attacker may obtain sensitiveinformation.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-53008` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

haproxy - 2.9.10-1ubuntu1
vim-haproxy - 2.9.10-1ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: haproxy package in oracular, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.9.10-1ubuntu1').
